result.execSummary:
The defendant Joseph N Berry was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Use of a Dangerous Weapon, Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

supervisions.notes:
Court denies defense motion for expungement. 
Court does not set a review hearing.

miscConds.notes: Pay mandatory costs, assessments, DV surcharge and surcharges or a civil judgment is to be entered against the defendant. Pay the supervision fees.

Obtain/maintain employment.
Obtain GED or HSED.
Defendant cannot possess firearms or ammunition.

No violations of the criminal law rising to the level of probable cause.
No contact with Sandra W. without the approval of the Court.

Complete the Batterers Intervention program.
Mental health evaluation.
Take prescribed medications as prescribed and keep agent informed.
Attend counseling as directed.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joseph N Berry

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Joseph N Berry in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Defendant Joseph N Berry in custody.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Sentencing proceeds.   State advises the Court they have complied with victim notification.  Statements by counsel, Sandra W. and defendant.  

Couynt 1:  COURT ORDERS defendant to serve 6 months at the House of Correction - straight time - with 1 day credit.  COURT STAYS the sentence and places the defendant on probation for a period of 2 years.

CONDITIONS:  1) no violations of the criminal law rising to the level of probable cause; 2) pay mandatory costs, assessments, DV surcharge and surcharges or a civil judgment is to be entered against the defendant; 3) no contact with Sandra W. without the approval of the Court; 4) complete the Batterer's Intervention program; 5) mental health evaluation; 6) obtain/maintain employment; 7) take prescribed medications as prescribed and keep agent informed; 8) attend counseling as directed; 9) obtain GED or HSED; 10) no contact with firearms; 11) pay the supervision fees.

COURT ORDERS:
- defendant cannot possess firearms or ammunition;
- defendant to have no contact with Sandra W. during the entire length of the sentence.  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Appeal rights given.  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief  received and filed.  Copy given to the defendant.

Court denies defense motion for expungement.  Court does not set a review hearing.

Defendant Joseph N Berry in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Defendant Joseph N Berry in custody.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Case heard for Br. 04.

Defendant waives constitutional rights, enters a plea of GUILTY and is examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum  received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the Complaint as a factual basis for judgment.  Court finds defendant guilty as charged in the Complaint and enters a judgment of conviction.
Due to branch 4 in trial, case transferred to branch 44 for Plea Hearing.   mld
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT PRODUCED FOR PURPOSES OF THE PROJECTED GUILTY PLEA AND SENTENCING IN BRANCH 4.

COURT WITHOUT FILE.
Attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke in court, Defendant Joseph N Berry not in court (in bullpen), in custody.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 10, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Joseph N Berry in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Discovery and offer received by defense counsel.  Upon the motion of the State, Court ordered the following cases consolidated for the purposes of trial:  Cases 2015CM581 and 2015CM826.  Upon review of the discovery, defense counsel can raise objection to the consolidation of cases, if needed.  Case adjourned for Jury Trial in Branch 4 on 6-10-2015 at 8:30 am.  Global offer will remain open until 6-3-2015, per the State.  All conditions of bail are continued, including no contact with Jesse H. or Sandra W, until further order of the Court.   mld

Defendant Joseph N Berry in court.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant appears Pro Se. 
 Defendant ordered to the Public Defender's Office to determine eligibility.  Defendant returns from Public Defender's Office.  Defendant does qualify for representation.  Case adjourned for Status of Counsel in Branch 4 on 3-17-2015 at 8:30 am.  All conditions of bail are continued, including no contact with Jesse H. or Sandra W., and commit no new crimes, until further order of the Court.   mld

15RM007823  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
02-15-2015
Cash bail that was previously posted to remain.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Jesse H and Sandra W.

Defendant Joseph N Berry in court.  Ann R. Lpez appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Flanagan, Branch 04.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant.  Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. 
Defendant was given a referral to the Public Defender's Office. Defendant MAY be Public Defender eligible. The case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Br. 04.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 2, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 2/16/15 @ 1:30pm
